text: Mehrgarh, () one of the most important Neolithic (7000 BC to 3200 BC) sites in archaeology, lies on the Kachhi Plain of Balochistan, Pakistan. It is one of the earliest sites with evidence of farming (wheat and barley) and herding (cattle, sheep and goats) in South Asia. It was rediscovered about 1974. Category:Archaeological sites in Pakistan Category:Ancient history of Pakistan Category:World Heritage Sites in Pakistan
title: Mehrgarh
